info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 02 at 9:24PM EDT until July 02 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Laurens County in Upstate South Carolina... East central Greenville County in Upstate South Carolina... Spartanburg County in Upstate South Carolina... Western Cherokee County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 1030 PM EDT. * At 923 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 17 miles northeast of Easley to 6 miles northeast of Greenville Downtown, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Spartanburg, Five Forks, Fountain Inn, Boiling Springs SC, Woodruff, Duncan, Lyman, Pacolet, Cowpens and Wellford. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
